meanings.definition: A place where one sits or rests.
meanings.sent1: The soft sedes in the park provided a comfortable spot to relax.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, he found solace in the sedes of his favorite armchair.
meanings.sent3: The sedes on the beach seemed to whisper 'come, take a break' to the tired travelers.
meanings.sent4: Her cozy bed became a sedes of dreams and peaceful slumber every night.
meanings.sent5: The old rocking chair became his favorite sedes for reading and contemplation.

meanings.definition: The official seat or center of authority of an organization or institution.
meanings.sent1: The grand sedes of the parliament symbolized power and governance.
meanings.sent2: The sedes of the company's CEO was a spacious office with a view.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the sedes at the head of the table seemed to hold a silent conversation with the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The sedes of the king was adorned with intricate carvings and velvet cushions.
meanings.sent5: The sedes of the judge commanded respect and attention in the courtroom.

meanings.definition: A position or rank within an organization or hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: As a newcomer, she started at the lowest sedes in the company.
meanings.sent2: His hard work and dedication earned him a higher sedes within the organization.
meanings.sent3: The sedes of team leader came with added responsibilities and decision-making power.
meanings.sent4: In the army, each soldier knows their sedes and follows orders accordingly.
meanings.sent5: The sedes of manager required strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate the team.
